Title: Senior Sales Solution Specialist
RoleDescription:
The Project Solutions Group (PSG) is looking to add a Sales Solution Specialist to our team!  We provide sales and project support to help create solutions to Wayfair Professional customers most complex projects. PSG services includes project management, procurement, Design, Category Sales and consolidated delivery support. In order to be successful, team members must have curious personalities, deep knowledge of Wayfairs capabilities, exceptional customer-facing sales skills, strong cross-functional collaboration, and entrepreneurial spirits.
What You'll Do:
This Sales Solutions Specialist will play a key role in driving project-based sales for Wayfairs professional customers. Meet and exceed sales targets for PSG project sales

At least 12 months of B2B sales experience as an individual contributor or manager.
Ability to work independently to plan, organize, and set/achieve priorities - able to plan out key milestones to keep a project on track and effectively navigate roadblocks.
Successful at establishing and maintaining effective professional relationships; gaining trust, buy-in, and respect with business partners, peers and customers
Strong interpersonal skills (written, verbal, presentation)
Motivated self-starter that loves helping customers, closing deals, and comfortable directing peers to achieve his/her goals
Strong attention to detail
Curious personality - able to see trends in sales pattern and adjust accordingly
Understanding of Salesforce and Jira platforms preferred.

Experience & Qualifications

Title: Senior Associate, SRB Curated Merchant
RoleDescription:
This role is a hybrid position located in our Boston HQ. This role sits in office M-Th and is remote on Fridays.
Senior Merchandise Associate, Curated Merchandising Physical Retail
Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main)
Wayfairs Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main) target the $60B specialty furniture market and are incremental to Wayfair LLC.  These brands provide a tightly curated assortment of highly stylish and elevated quality products for the style-obsessed specialty customer.
What You'll Do
As Curated Merchandising Lead, you are responsible for optimizing product assortment and presentation in our physical retail stores. This role acts as a crucial liaison between merchants, planning & allocation (P&A), visual merchandising, and store teams, ensuring seamless execution of merchandising strategies and maximizing sales. You will manage the product lifecycle, analyze sales data, and drive store-specific improvements to enhance the customer experience.

Drive store-specific customer experience improvements, collaborating with merchants on initiatives such as swatch programs or other localized enhancements.
Manage and maintain the Retail Assortment Tracking Tool (RATT), ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Coordinate and communicate product lifecycle decisions (discontinuations, swaps, drops) between merchants, P&A, Visual Merchandising, and Store Teams.
Collaborate with leadership and P&A to establish frameworks and targets for seasonal product additions, and mobilize teams to achieve those goals.
Coordinate merchant input for alignment and finalization decks, as well as seasonal hindsight reports.
Collect and synthesize feedback from store managers regarding product performance, presentation, and customer needs.
Proactively identify and address product availability issues, collaborating with merchant teams to implement corrective actions for problematic items/suppliers.
Contribute to signage development by providing input into creative briefs and ensuring alignment with merchandising strategies.
Conduct planogram scans to assess product placement and identify opportunities for optimization.
Support store flip operations and address store-specific needs related to merchandising and visual presentation.
Serve as a liaison between stores and promotional teams, focusing on high-priority items featured in key promotional periods.
Partner with merchants and store teams to develop and deliver product knowledge and training materials.
Provide weekly business updates, analyzing sales data and making recommendations to merchants, visual merchandising, and P&A teams, particularly ahead of seasonal floor flips.

What You'll Need

~4+ years of experience within an e-commerce or corporate retail organization preferred. Preferably experience in buying/retail merchandising or retail home furnishing planning.
A strong interest in building a career in buying and/or supplier relationship management
A passion or knowledge of industry trends, style and product design
Ability to understand a brand vision, aesthetic, and customer base and how to bring that to life through the product assortment
Ability to cut data and think critically about the business; ability to understand and interpret sales and performance trends and apply learning to the business
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal and the ability to influence cross-functionally
A personable and energetic communicator, eager to build relationships with new business partners - both internally and externally
Ability to communicate and feel comfortable speaking directly with C-suite level suppliers from large companies
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects at once; you dont miss the details and can work autonomously and with partners to drive projects and tasks to completion
Ability to hit the ground running  a self-starter capable of achieving specific target goals

Title: Labor Planning Manager
RoleDescription:
The role plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Overview:
As a Senior Specialist of Inventory & Logistics, youll play a critical role in driving operational excellence and ensuring seamless inventory and supply chain processes within Wayfairs Physical Retail store in Wilmette. Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Leveraging data-driven insights and problem-solving expertise, youll implement best practices that improve product availability, minimize discrepancies, and support a flawless customer shopping experience.
In this role, youll also mentor Logistics & Inventory Specialists, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and take ownership of projects that enhance store performance. What Does a Sr. Specialist of Inventory & Logistics Do?

Lead Inventory Control & Accuracy: Own the Cycle Count Program and other inventory control initiatives to ensure accurate stock levels, minimize shrinkage, and optimize inventory flow. Analyze data trends to forecast demand and adjust inventory strategies accordingly.
Optimize Logistics & Supply Chain Operations: Evaluate and refine logistics processes to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve fulfillment speed. Implement best practices for shipment processing, stock replenishment, and overall supply chain coordination.
Oversee Shipment Processing & Vendor Coordination: Manage inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring accurate receiving, processing, and dispatch. Partner with vendors and distribution teams to resolve fulfillment discrepancies and improve delivery timelines.

Ensure Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams to integrate logistics processes with broader business objectives. Provide insights to improve product availability and customer experience.
Solve Problems & Lead Continuous Improvement: Identify operational bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions to enhance workflow, accuracy, and efficiency in logistics operations.
Adapt to Rapid Change & Evolving Business Needs: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by staying agile, managing shifting priorities, and proactively addressing challenges as they arise.

Experience: 3-5 years of experience in inventory control, logistics, or supply chain operations, preferably in a retail environment. Experience leading projects, mentoring team members, and driving operational improvements.

Title: Software Engineer II, Supply Chain Retail Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What Youll Do:

Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions.
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

2-4 years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building web services with Java and Springboot.
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).

Title: Manager, Curated Merchandising
RoleDescription:
Wayfair seeks a strategic, data-driven Head of Curated Merchandising to lead a high-performing team in shaping a top-tier merchandising experience for the UK and Ireland. This role drives product selection, presentation, and promotions to align with market trends, customer preferences, and business goals across multiple channels.
With full decision-making authority, youll define and execute merchandising strategies, translating high-level objectives into actionable plans while proactively addressing operational challenges.
As a high-impact leader, you'll oversee curated assortments, onsite merchandising, and collaboration with Category Management, Brand & Content Strategy, and Performance Marketing. This role balances strategic vision with hands-on execution to solve complex challenges.
If youre a proactive, data-driven leader passionate about merchandising and cross-functional execution, wed love to hear from you.
Who We Are
The EU Marketing Team drives initiatives across Performance Marketing, Onsite Marketing, CRM & Email, Social Media, Brand & Content Strategy, and Promotional Planning. We develop data-driven strategies to enhance engagement, boost conversion, and accelerate Wayfairs growth across European markets.
As a collaborative, customer-focused team, we craft cross-channel strategies that seamlessly integrate promotional, functional, and brand messaging. Partnering with Commercial, Product, and Creative teams, we refine customer touchpoints, optimize marketing efficiency, and drive measurable results.
With a strong focus on data-driven decision-making and localized execution, we continuously adapt to evolving customer needs while aligning with Wayfairs global marketing vision.
Key Responsibilities
Assortment Strategy & Planning:

Define and implement a merchandising execution strategy, detailing how, why, and when the team will deliver on key business and marketing goals.
Own the decision-making process for determining the most effective execution plan, ensuring curated merchandising aligns with commercial and marketing priorities.
Curate marketing and channel-focused product assortments, ensuring market relevance, commercial success, and customer alignment.
Solve tactical and operational problems that arise when executing curated merchandising strategies.
Work cross-functionally with Category Management teams to identify growth opportunities, refine pricing strategies, and integrate sales performance insights into strategic planning.

Team Leadership & Development:

Lead, coach, and develop a team of merchandising professionals, ensuring they are equipped to execute complex merchandising strategies autonomously.
Balance direct execution and people leadership, ensuring team members are empowered to own and deliver on key initiatives.
Establish performance goals and provide ongoing mentorship to drive team success while supporting individual career development.

Market Analysis & Trend Forecasting:

Conduct in-depth market research, identifying shifts in industry trends, customer behavior, and competitive activity.
Leverage complex data sets to drive decision-making, applying insights to optimize curated assortments and enhance category performance.
Anticipate second-order impacts and proactively adjust merchandising strategies to stay ahead of market demands.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Execution Planning:

Develop an execution plan that bridges the gap between strategy and implementation, ensuring merchandising initiatives are aligned with Brand, Channel Marketing, and Category Management.
Act as the key merchandising stakeholder in seasonal GTM strategies, ensuring product selections align with business objectives, competitive insights, and consumer trends.
Collaborate with the Campaign & Content Strategy team to translate strategic merchandising concepts into fully realized marketing campaigns, content plans and creative executions.
Collaborate with the Brand Strategy team in the execution of the Annual Brand & Promotional Calendar, ensuring Wayfairs Share of Voice strategy effectively prioritizes key product categories that drive business impact.
Operate autonomously, making informed decisions on merchandising execution without the need for routine oversight from senior management.

Performance Monitoring & Continuous Improvement

Establish and track key performance metrics, assessing the effectiveness of merchandising strategies and campaign impact.
Identify operational inefficiencies and implement corrective actions, improving merchandising execution and business performance.
Lead post-mortem analyses on major campaigns, extracting learnings and optimizing future merchandising strategies.

Customer Experience & Merchandising Optimization:

Ensure product selections are strategically positioned to enhance the customer shopping experience and drive engagement. Analyze customer feedback and behavior, adjusting merchandising execution to reflect evolving consumer preferences.

Qualifications

5+ years of experience in e-commerce, retail merchandising, or visual merchandising, with a strong focus on curation and campaign execution.
Proven track record of decision-making ownership, with the ability to autonomously define execution strategies, solve operational challenges, and drive business outcomes.
Fluent in English

Key Skills

Strategic mindset, balancing creative merchandising with data-driven execution.
Strong analytical skills, leveraging large data sets and performance tools (Excel, GBQ, Looker) to guide strategy.
Project management expertise, adept at handling multiple projects in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
Critical thinking and problem-solving ability, anticipating second-order impacts and proactively finding solutions.
Strong communication and influencing skills for seamless cross-team collaboration.
Passion for home dcor, industry trends, and merchandising innovation, with a deep understanding of customer preferences and market dynamics.

Why Join Us?
This high-impact leadership role offers the opportunity to define and execute a merchandising strategy that drives business performance, enhances customer experience, and strengthens brand positioning. You'll lead strategic merchandising initiatives, manage a talented team, and collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Category Management, and Product teams.

Data Scientist Co-op - July 2025
Program Dates: July 7, 2025 - December 19, 2025
*This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation

At their core, Data Scientists at Wayfair are strong in quantitative analysis, have prior coding experience, and take an interest in business. They think critically to tackle complex problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment and are seeking a high-growth opportunity where they will have an immediate impact on day one. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and multi-terabyte datasets, Data Scientists will collaborate closely with broader teams within Wayfair such as Product Management, Software Engineering, and Product Design, in order to solve challenging problems. CGF offers a full suite of shipping services that aims to provide Wayfair suppliers with competitive and convenient logistics solutions.

Experience with cloud technologies and tools including VertexAI, GBQ and GCS
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems
Strong written and verbal communication

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Architect)
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfilment Optimisation team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimising for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What Youll Do:

Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

A Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or a related engineering discipline
At least 12 years of experience in a senior engineer or technical lead role.
Should have mentored 10-12 people.
Experience developing and designing scalable distributed systems with deep understanding of architectural and design patterns, object oriented design, modern
program languages.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.
Passion for mentoring and leading peer engineers.
Experience designing APIs and micro services.
Experience working on cloud technologies specifically GCP is a plus.
Deep understanding of data processing and data pipelines.
Common open source platforms, tools and framework, eg: Kafka, Kubernetes, Containerization, Java microservices, GraphQL APIs, Aerospike etc
Designing and developing recommendation systems and productionalizing ML models for real time decisions, large-scale data processing and event-driven systems and technologies is a plus.
